message.content:
We start by extracting the key numerical amounts from the three statements.

──────────────────────────────
1. Current Ratio  
Formula: Current Ratio = (Total Current Assets) / (Total Current Liabilities)  
From the balance sheet:  
• Total Current Assets (End) = 22,474,420.77  
• Total Current Liabilities (End) = 3,143,833.89  
Calculation:  
  Current Ratio = 22,474,420.77 / 3,143,833.89 ≈ 7.15

──────────────────────────────
2. Gross Profit Margin  
Formula: Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
From the income statement:  
• Gross Profit = 6,476,677.56  
• Total Revenue = 22,876,677.56  
Calculation:  
  Margin = (6,476,677.56 / 22,876,677.56) × 100% ≈ 28.33%

──────────────────────────────
3. Debt to Asset Ratio  
Formula: Debt to Asset Ratio = (Total Liabilities) / (Total Assets)  
Here Total Liabilities are computed as:  
  Total Liabilities = Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity − Total Owner's Equity  
From the balance sheet:  
• Total Liabilities and Owner's Equity (End) = 33,082,821.36  
• Total Owner's Equity (End) = 29,938,987.47  
Thus,  
  Total Liabilities = 33,082,821.36 − 29,938,987.47 = 3,143,833.89  
Also, Total Assets (End) = 33,082,821.36  
Calculation:  
  Debt to Asset Ratio = 3,143,833.89 / 33,082,821.36 ≈ 0.095 (or about 0.10 when rounded)

──────────────────────────────
4. Net Profit Margin  
Formula: Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) × 100%  
From the income statement:  
• Net Profit = 1,938,987.47  
• Total Revenue = 22,876,677.56  
Calculation:  
  Net Profit Margin = (1,938,987.47 / 22,876,677.56) × 100% ≈ 8.47%

──────────────────────────────
5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio  
Formula: Cash to Current Debt Ratio = (Cash and Cash Equivalents) / (Total Current Liabilities)  
From the cash flow statement – ending balance:  
• Cash and Cash Equivalents = 498,569.02  
• Total Current Liabilities (from balance sheet) = 3,143,833.89  
Calculation:  
  Ratio = 498,569.02 / 3,143,833.89 ≈ 0.16

──────────────────────────────
6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)  
Definition (as used in our example): FCF = (Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities) + (Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities)  
From the cash flow statement:  
• Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = -16,772,398.72  
• Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities = -2,729,032.26  
Calculation:  
  FCF = -16,772,398.72 + (-2,729,032.26) = -19,501,430.98

──────────────────────────────
7. Return on Assets (ROA)  
Formula: ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%  
From:  
• Net Profit = 1,938,987.47  
• Total Assets (End) = 33,082,821.36  
Calculation:  
  ROA = (1,938,987.47 / 33,082,821.36) × 100% ≈ 5.86%

──────────────────────────────
Presenting the solution in the required JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "7.15",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "28.33%",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.10",
    "Net Profit Margin": "8.47%",
    "Cash to Current Debt Ratio": "0.16",
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-19501430.98",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "5.86%"
  }
}
